summary: A letter from Commonwealth Bank of Australia to a customer named Mr. Praljak, dated October 9, 2018, informing him that the bank is unable to recover $350 he transferred via electronic payment to an account at ANZ Bank on October 17, 2017. The bank states ANZ Bank has declined to return the funds and that they cannot disclose the destination account holder's identity without consent or a court order.

persons.name: Mr. Praljak
persons.context: Customer of Commonwealth Bank of Australia who attempted to recover $350 transferred to an ANZ Bank account on October 17, 2017.

events.title: Electronic funds transfer
events.description: Mr. Praljak transferred $350 via electronic payment to an account at ANZ Bank.

events.title: Bank declines fund recovery request
events.description: Commonwealth Bank of Australia informs Mr. Praljak that ANZ Bank has declined their request to return the $350 he transferred and that they cannot reverse the transaction or disclose the recipient's identity without consent or a court order.

locations: Commonwealth Bank of Australia, 31 Binge Ave, PO Box 492, Lidcombe NSW 2141, Australia
keyFacts: On October 17, 2017, a customer named Mr. Praljak transferred $350 to an account at ANZ Bank.
On October 9, 2018, Commonwealth Bank of Australia informed Mr. Praljak they were unable to recover the funds because ANZ Bank declined the request.
The bank stated it could not reverse the transaction or disclose the destination account holder's identity without the holder's consent or a court order.
The document is a standard customer service letter regarding a failed fund recovery attempt, with no direct mention of Jeffrey Epstein, his associates, or related criminal activities.
The reference number for the transaction is CN 4897260.
